main event: A UFO was observed by Major General Carl A. Brandt, Vice Commander of ATC, in the vicinity of Knoxville, Tennessee on June 22, 1958.
interesting points: The UFO appeared to be smaller than a pencil, brilliant white, made no sound, and disappeared silently after leaving a streak with no residual trail.
The UFO was sighted above a thunderstorm, at an angle of elevation of 30 degrees and a relative bearing of 215 degrees, before instantaneously disappearing to the south.
The observation was made from a T-29 aircraft at 12,000 feet altitude, with no optical aids used.
The UFO was only visible for 2-3 seconds and was described by a completely reliable observer, Major General Carl A. Brandt.
There was no other data available, and the weather conditions at the time were reported to include scattered clouds and overcast skies with 9 miles of visibility, with no thunderstorms reported.
witnesses: Completely reliable observer: Major General Carl A. Brandt
photographs: No photographs were mentioned in the report
